Color: Their plumage has a distinctive bright blue-gray color that goes from the head down the back, wings, and tail.
Ecosystem: trees, rocky shores, and edgy lands
Diet: small fish, especially sardines, and anchovies, but also squid, krill and small octopus

Color: The adult bird has chocolate brown upper parts and is white on its face mask, throat, lower breast, and belly. It has a broad brown breast band along with brown undertail coverts. Its underwings are white except for the dark tip and the dark leading edge.

Males have purple patches on their wings, while the females have mainly brown-speckled plumage. Both sexes have an area of white-bordered black or iridescent blue feathers called a speculum on their wings.
Males have bold black-and-white coloring. Females are light brown.
Diet: seeds, shrubs, grass, fruit, flowers, insects, and small reptiles

Color: They have dark chestnut heads, chins, throats, breasts, and necks, with blackish brown on the top side of the body. They also have white eyes.
Ecosystem: shallow lakes and marshes with dense vegetation

Color: Mottled brown, rufous, black, and white above, barred brown and white below.
Ecosystem: tallgrass and mixed-grass prairies interspersed with farmland, brushy areas, and occasional oak copses

Color: Its upperparts, belly, tail and most of the bill are black, and the uppertail and undertail coverts are red. The bare eye-patch and bill base are blue, the throat is white, most of the central breast is yellow-orange fading to white laterally and the lower breast sharply contrasts with a broad transverse red band.
Diet: fruit-eater but will take insects, small reptiles, eggs and frogs

Color: Their plumage is generally pale brown with small black spots and bands all over. It has iridescent blue-green eyespots with a buff border on its upperwings, back, and on the 22 rectrices.
Diet: fruits, invertebrates, insects, mollusks, and seeds

Color: The plumage of adult birds is blue-grey with darker slaty-grey flight feathers.
Diet: aquatic prey such as lungfish, bichirs, tilapia, catfish, and water snakes, and sometimes frogs, monitor lizards, turtles, young crocodiles, mollusks, and carrion

Color: They have a black head and hindneck, buff cheeks and heavily furrowed neck. The neck has black and white diagonal stripes.
Ecosystem: shrubland, grassland, coastal dunes, and lava plains
Diet: leaves, seeds, fruit, and flowers of grasses and shrubs
